department.dept_long_name: Department of the History of Art and Architecture

course.title: The Western Tradition: Art Since the Renaissance
course.description: Concentrating on painting but with reference to other media, we examine art between the beginning of Modern Times around 1400 until the present. It is team taught and organized around specific topics each occupying one week. It is organized chronologically but does not attempt to be a comprehensive survey, but rather to highlight important issues, debates, innovations, specific works or artists.
course.notes: This course, when taken for a letter grade, meets the General Education requirement for Aesthetic and Interpretive Understanding. This course fulfills the requirement that one of the eight General Education courses also engage substantially with Study of the Past.
